verses.text: Know ye not, brethren, (for I speak to them that know the law,) how that the law hath dominion over a man as long as he liveth?

similars.text: And the law is not of faith: but, The man that doeth them shall live in them.
Hearken unto me, ye that know righteousness, the people in whose heart I have written my law, fear ye not the reproach of men, neither be ye afraid of their revilings.
And they shall not teach every man his neighbour, and every man his brother, saying, Know the Lord: for all shall know me, from the least to the greatest.
Hearken unto me, ye that know righteousness, the people in whose heart is my law; fear ye not the reproach of men, neither be ye afraid of their revilings.

Speak not evil one of another, brethren. He that speaketh evil of his brother, and judgeth his brother, speaketh evil of the law, and judgeth the law: but if thou judge the law, thou art not a doer of the law, but a judge.

verses.text: For the woman which hath an husband is bound by the law to her husband so long as he liveth; but if the husband be dead, she is loosed from the law of her husband.

similars.text: The wife is bound by the law as long as her husband liveth; but if her husband be dead, she is at liberty to be married to whom she will; only in the Lord.

So then if, while her husband liveth, she be married to another man, she shall be called an adulteress: but if her husband be dead, she is free from that law; so that she is no adulteress, though she be married to another man.

Therefore, if a man marry him a wife in the world, and he marry her not by me nor by my word, and he covenant with her so long as he is in the world and she with him, their covenant and marriage are not of force when they are dead, and when they are out of the world; therefore, they are not bound by any law when they are out of the world.

If brethren dwell together, and one of them die, and have no child, the wife of the dead shall not marry without unto a stranger: her husband's brother shall go in unto her, and take her to him to wife, and perform the duty of an husband's brother unto her.
And the woman which hath an husband that believeth not, and if he be pleased to dwell with her, let her not leave him.
The wife is bound by the law as long as her husband liveth; but if her husband be dead, she is at liberty to be married to whom she will; only in the Lord.
The wife is bound by the law as long as her husband liveth; but if her husband be dead, she is at liberty to be married to whom she will; only in the Lord.

So then if, while her husband liveth, she be married to another man, she shall be called an adulteress: but if her husband be dead, she is free from that law; so that she is no adulteress, though she be married to another man.

verses.text: So then if, while her husband liveth, she be married to another man, she shall be called an adulteress: but if her husband be dead, she is free from that law; so that she is no adulteress, though she be married to another man.

similars.text: For the woman which hath an husband is bound by the law to her husband so long as he liveth; but if the husband be dead, she is loosed from the law of her husband.
The wife is bound by the law as long as her husband liveth; but if her husband be dead, she is at liberty to be married to whom she will; only in the Lord.
And if a woman shall put away her husband, and be married to another, she committeth adultery.

If brethren dwell together, and one of them die, and have no child, the wife of the dead shall not marry without unto a stranger: her husband's brother shall go in unto her, and take her to him to wife, and perform the duty of an husband's brother unto her.
But and if she depart, let her remain unmarried, or be reconciled to her husband: and let not the husband put away his wife.
Whosoever putteth away his wife, and marrieth another, committeth adultery: and whosoever marrieth her that is put away from her husband committeth adultery.

Therefore, if a man marry him a wife in the world, and he marry her not by me nor by my word, and he covenant with her so long as he is in the world and she with him, their covenant and marriage are not of force when they are dead, and when they are out of the world; therefore, they are not bound by any law when they are out of the world.
If he take him another wife; her food, her raiment, and her duty of marriage, shall he not diminish.
And when she is departed out of his house, she may go and be another man's wife.
If she be not in the new and everlasting covenant, and she be with another man, she has committed adultery.
For the woman which hath an husband is bound by the law to her husband so long as he liveth; but if the husband be dead, she is loosed from the law of her husband.
The wife is bound by the law as long as her husband liveth; but if her husband be dead, she is at liberty to be married to whom she will; only in the Lord.

verses.text: Wherefore, my brethren, ye also are become dead to the law by the body of Christ; that ye should be married to another, even to him who is raised from the dead, that we should bring forth fruit unto God.

similars.text: If brethren dwell together, and one of them die, and have no child, the wife of the dead shall not marry without unto a stranger: her husband's brother shall go in unto her, and take her to him to wife, and perform the duty of an husband's brother unto her.
For, for this end was the law given; wherefore the law hath become dead unto us, and we are made alive in Christ because of our faith; yet we keep the law because of the commandments.

And again, verily I say unto you, if a man marry a wife by my word, which is my law, and by the new and everlasting covenant, and it is sealed unto them by the Holy Spirit of promise, by him who is anointed, unto whom I have appointed this power and the keys of this priesthood; and it shall be said unto them--Ye shall come forth in the first resurrection; and if it be after the first resurrection, in the next resurrection; and shall inherit thrones, kingdoms, principalities, and powers, dominions, all heights and depths--then shall it be written in the Lamb's Book of Life, that he shall commit no murder whereby to shed innocent blood, and if ye abide in my covenant, and commit no murder whereby to shed innocent blood, it shall be done unto them in all things whatsoever my servant hath put upon them, in time, and through all eternity; and shall be of full force when they are out of the world; and they shall pass by the angels, and the gods, which are set there, to their exaltation and glory in all things, as hath been sealed upon their heads, which glory shall be a fulness and a continuation of the seeds forever and ever.
Wherefore if ye be dead with Christ from the rudiments of the world, why, as though living in the world, are ye subject to ordinances,

That by reason of transgression cometh the fall, which fall bringeth death, and inasmuch as ye were born into the world by water, and blood, and the spirit, which I have made, and so became of dust a living soul, even so ye must be born again into the kingdom of heaven, of water, and of the Spirit, and be cleansed by blood, even the blood of mine Only Begotten; that ye might be sanctified from all sin, and enjoy the words of eternal life in this world, and eternal life in the world to come, even immortal glory;
And after Christ shall have risen from the dead he shall show himself unto you, my children, and my beloved brethren; and the words which he shall speak unto you shall be the law which ye shall do.
Saying, Master, Moses wrote unto us, If any man's brother die, having a wife, and he die without children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.

And again, verily I say unto you, if a man marry a wife, and make a covenant with her for time and for all eternity, if that covenant is not by me or by my word, which is my law, and is not sealed by the Holy Spirit of promise, through him whom I have anointed and appointed unto this power, then it is not valid neither of force when they are out of the world, because they are not joined by me, saith the Lord, neither by my word; when they are out of the world it cannot be received there, because the angels and the gods are appointed there, by whom they cannot pass; they cannot, therefore, inherit my glory; for my house is a house of order, saith the Lord God.
His disciples say unto him, If the case of the man be so with his wife, it is not good to marry.
For I through the law am dead to the law, that I might live unto God.

verses.text: For when we were in the flesh, the motions of sins, which were by the law, did work in our members to bring forth fruit unto death.

similars.text: The labour of the righteous tendeth to life: the fruit of the wicked to sin.

verses.text: But now we are delivered from the law, that being dead wherein we were held; that we should serve in newness of spirit, and not in the oldness of the letter.
What shall we say then? Is the law sin? God forbid. Nay, I had not known sin, but by the law: for I had not known lust, except the law had said, Thou shalt not covet.

similars.text: Therefore by the deeds of the law there shall no flesh be justified in his sight: for by the law is the knowledge of sin.
What then? shall we sin, because we are not under the law, but under grace? God forbid.
(For until the law sin was in the world: but sin is not imputed when there is no law.

verses.text: But sin, taking occasion by the commandment, wrought in me all manner of concupiscence. For without the law sin was dead.

similars.text: For I was alive without the law once: but when the commandment came, sin revived, and I died.
For sin, taking occasion by the commandment, deceived me, and by it slew me.
And the commandment, which was ordained to life, I found to be unto death.
For I was alive without the law once: but when the commandment came, sin revived, and I died.
For sin, taking occasion by the commandment, deceived me, and by it slew me.

verses.text: For I was alive without the law once: but when the commandment came, sin revived, and I died.

similars.text: But sin, taking occasion by the commandment, wrought in me all manner of concupiscence. For without the law sin was dead.

For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus hath made me free from the law of sin and death.
And the commandment, which was ordained to life, I found to be unto death.
But sin, taking occasion by the commandment, wrought in me all manner of concupiscence. For without the law sin was dead.

verses.text: And the commandment, which was ordained to life, I found to be unto death.

similars.text: For I through the law am dead to the law, that I might live unto God.
For I know that thou wilt bring me to death, and to the house appointed for all living.
Was then that which is good made death unto me? God forbid. But sin, that it might appear sin, working death in me by that which is good; that sin by the commandment might become exceeding sinful.
But sin, taking occasion by the commandment, wrought in me all manner of concupiscence. For without the law sin was dead.
For I was alive without the law once: but when the commandment came, sin revived, and I died.

verses.text: For sin, taking occasion by the commandment, deceived me, and by it slew me.

similars.text: But sin, taking occasion by the commandment, wrought in me all manner of concupiscence. For without the law sin was dead.
I made haste, and delayed not to keep thy commandments.
But sin, taking occasion by the commandment, wrought in me all manner of concupiscence. For without the law sin was dead.

verses.text: Wherefore the law is holy, and the commandment holy, and just, and good.

similars.text: To keep the commandments of the Lord, and his statutes, which I command thee this day for thy good?
Wherefore, meaning the church, thou shalt give heed unto all his words and commandments which he shall give unto you as he receiveth them, walking in all holiness before me;
Thus, none shall be exempted from the justice and the laws of God, that all things may be done in order and in solemnity before him, according to truth and righteousness.
Therefore thou shalt love the Lord thy God, and keep his charge, and his statutes, and his judgments, and his commandments, alway.

verses.text: Was then that which is good made death unto me? God forbid. But sin, that it might appear sin, working death in me by that which is good; that sin by the commandment might become exceeding sinful.

similars.text: And the commandment, which was ordained to life, I found to be unto death.
Again, when I say unto the wicked, Thou shalt surely die; if he turn from his sin, and do that which is lawful and right;

He hath given unto you that ye might know good from evil, and he hath given unto you that ye might choose life or death; and ye can do good and be restored unto that which is good, or have that which is good restored unto you; or ye can do evil, and have that which is evil restored unto you.

verses.text: For we know that the law is spiritual: but I am carnal, sold under sin.

similars.text: I thank God through Jesus Christ our Lord. So then with the mind I myself serve the law of God; but with the flesh the law of sin.

verses.text: For that which I do I allow not: for what I would, that do I not; but what I hate, that do I.

similars.text: For the good that I would I do not: but the evil which I would not, that I do.

verses.text: If then I do that which I would not, I consent unto the law that it is good.

similars.text: For the good that I would I do not: but the evil which I would not, that I do.
I find then a law, that, when I would do good, evil is present with me.
For the good that I would I do not: but the evil which I would not, that I do.

verses.text: Now then it is no more I that do it, but sin that dwelleth in me.

similars.text: Now if I do that I would not, it is no more I that do it, but sin that dwelleth in me.
That which I see not teach thou me: if I have done iniquity, I will do no more.
And now I give unto you no more at this time. Amen.
And he that hath no understanding, it remaineth in me to do according as it is written. And now I declare no more unto you at this time. Amen.
And I will do in thee that which I have not done, and whereunto I will not do any more the like, because of all thine abominations.
Nevertheless, thou art not excusable in thy transgressions; nevertheless, go thy way and sin no more.
If I sin, then thou markest me, and thou wilt not acquit me from mine iniquity.
Now if I do that I would not, it is no more I that do it, but sin that dwelleth in me.

verses.text: For I know that in me (that is, in my flesh,) dwelleth no good thing: for to will is present with me; but how to perform that which is good I find not.
For the good that I would I do not: but the evil which I would not, that I do.

similars.text: If then I do that which I would not, I consent unto the law that it is good.
If it do evil in my sight, that it obey not my voice, then I will repent of the good, wherewith I said I would benefit them.
Let not then your good be evil spoken of:
For that which I do I allow not: for what I would, that do I not; but what I hate, that do I.

But if ye will not do so, behold, ye have sinned against the Lord: and be sure your sin will find you out.
For I will declare mine iniquity; I will be sorry for my sin.
And now, my son, I would to God that ye had not been guilty of so great a crime. I would not dwell upon your crimes, to harrow up your soul, if it were not for your good.
Now then it is no more I that do it, but sin that dwelleth in me.

similars.text: If it do evil in my sight, that it obey not my voice, then I will repent of the good, wherewith I said I would benefit them.
They also that render evil for good are mine adversaries; because I follow the thing that good is.
Is it not lawful for me to do what I will with mine own? Is thine eye evil, because I am good?
If then I do that which I would not, I consent unto the law that it is good.
And it is given unto them to know good from evil; wherefore they are agents unto themselves, and I have given unto you another law and commandment.
It is good for me that I have been afflicted; that I might learn thy statutes.

verses.text: For I delight in the law of God after the inward man:

similars.text: I delight to do thy will, O my God: yea, thy law is within my heart.
But his delight is in the law of the Lord; and in his law doth he meditate day and night.
I have longed for thy salvation, O Lord; and thy law is my delight.
And I will delight myself in thy commandments, which I have loved.
I delight to do thy will, O my God: yea, thy law is within my heart.

verses.text: But I see another law in my members, warring against the law of my mind, and bringing me into captivity to the law of sin which is in my members.
O wretched man that I am! who shall deliver me from the body of this death?

similars.text: Deliver me, O my God, out of the hand of the wicked, out of the hand of the unrighteous and cruel man.
Deliver me, O Lord, from the evil man: preserve me from the violent man;

And this death of which I have spoken, which is the spiritual death, shall deliver up its dead; which spiritual death is hell; wherefore, death and hell must deliver up their dead, and hell must deliver up its captive spirits, and the grave must deliver up its captive bodies, and the bodies and the spirits of men will be restored one to the other; and it is by the power of the resurrection of the Holy One of Israel.
And I will deliver thee out of the hand of the wicked, and I will redeem thee out of the hand of the terrible.
He that smiteth a man, so that he die, shall be surely put to death.
Behold, here is the man, we deliver him into thy hands; thou mayest do with him as seemeth thee good.
And he said, What have I sinned, that thou wouldest deliver thy servant into the hand of Ahab, to slay me?
And if thou deal thus with me, kill me, I pray thee, out of hand, if I have found favour in thy sight; and let me not see my wretchedness.
Judge me, O God, and plead my cause against an ungodly nation: O deliver me from the deceitful and unjust man.
Then called I upon the name of the Lord; O Lord, I beseech thee, deliver my soul.
Have mercy upon me, O Lord; consider my trouble which I suffer of them that hate me, thou that liftest me up from the gates of death:
For the king will hear, to deliver his handmaid out of the hand of the man that would destroy me and my son together out of the inheritance of God.
Behold, I am vile; what shall I answer thee? I will lay mine hand upon my mouth.

verses.text: I thank God through Jesus Christ our Lord. So then with the mind I myself serve the law of God; but with the flesh the law of sin.

similars.text: For we know that the law is spiritual: but I am carnal, sold under sin.
I am the Lord thy God, and will give unto thee the law of my Holy Priesthood, as was ordained by me and my Father before the world was.
But God be thanked, that ye were the servants of sin, but ye have obeyed from the heart that form of doctrine which was delivered you.
Now therefore, I pray thee, pardon my sin, and turn again with me, that I may worship the Lord.
For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus hath made me free from the law of sin and death.
I delight to do thy will, O my God: yea, thy law is within my heart.
I am Jesus Christ; I came by the will of the Father, and I do his will.
